column4: what config file specifies the modules loaded by the kernel at startup?  it doesn't seem to be /etc/rc.conf, and while i've found a file /etc/init/rc.conf, it doesn't seem to have a modules array.
/etc/modules and /etc/modprobe.d
can you explain the function that each serves?
the function each what serves?
why did you cite both a file (/etc/modules) and a directory (/etc/modprobe.d)?
the file contains modules, the directory contains a bunch of files with the same use as the /etc/modules file
each file in /etc/modprobe.d is treated like /etc/modules
hm.  i looked at the files in /etc/modules and it seems like they are more complicated.  /etc/modules says to simply list names of modules on each line that should be loaded at startup
and what do the fies in /etc/modprobe.d have?
